title: Jerome Yang | Three Gems in the Lower South

pages.title: Three Gems in the Lower South
A spontaneous trip
text: I was not just missing the warmth, which I hadn't enjoyed since moving back to New England. What is the South? How's it like to be there? My curiosity drove me to visit this unfamiliar area. In late March, just a week before this trip, I caught a good flight ticket deal online. That's essentially why and how I decided to go.

It's not easy to visit three states in three days. My strategy is: pick only one city in each state, fly to the first, take a train or bus from one to the next, and fly back from the last. These three cities are:

Charleston, SC
Founded in 1670; used to be a state capital, trade center, and had ranked among the top 10 US cities for over 100 years.

Savannah, GA
Founded in 1733 as the capital of the Colony of Georgia. Was a slave-free city until Georgia legalized slavery.

St Augustine, FL
Founded in 1565 by Spanish army. Oldest continuously inhabited settlement in the US. Has a unique mix of Spanish, British, American, Indian and African cultures.
Let's start with my first flight: BOS to CLT.

pages.title: Charlotte Douglas Int'l Airport
pages.text: A 2-hour layover gave me the first chance to grasp the feeling of "south".
